title: processes
description: Information about running processes of a scanned system

executablePath.description: Path to the executable file of the process, if it could be determined

executableMD5.description: MD5 hexdigest of the executable file, if the file could be read

executableSHA256.description: SHA256 hexdigest of the executable file, if the file could be read

username.description: Name of the user, which the process is executed under

parentBaseAddress.description: Address of the parent segment. This is equal to baseAddress if the segment is a root segment. Note, this value can get very large. make sure your parser uses an int64.

baseAddress.description: Address of this segment. Note, this value can get very large. make sure your parser uses an int64.

allocatedPermissions.description: The permissions, this segment was initialized with

currentPermissions.description: The permissions, this segment had during time of the scan

size.description: Size of the segment in bytes. Note, this value can get very large. make sure your parser uses an int64.

rss.description: The resident set size (RSS) of the segment in bytes. Only applicable on linux. Note, this value can get very large. make sure your parser uses an int64.

state.description: The state of the segment. Note that the state "reserve" is an approximation on linux; this will be set if the RSS is exactly zero.

type.description: The type of the memory segment

SHA256.description: SHA256 hexdigest of the mapped file, if the file could be read

path.description: The path of the mapped file

MD5.description: MD5 hexdigest of the mapped file, if the file could be read
